thread.title: Taco Bell is pulling new chicken-shelled chalupa | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Taco Bell is pulling new chicken-shelled chalupa | Daily Mail Online

author: Valerie Edwards For Dailymail.Com
title: Taco Bell is pulling new chicken-shelled chalupa | Daily Mail Online
text: comments A Taco Bell treat that has a shell made entirely of fried chicken will vanish from the fast food chain's menu despite its popularity. Taco Bell spokesman Rob Poetsch says the Naked Chicken Chalupa always was planned as a limited-time offer, but it has proven to be popular and exceeded the company's expectations. A date for the end of its run hasn't been announced. The Taco Bell Naked Chicken Chalupa (pictured) that has a shell made entirely of fried chicken will vanish from the fast food chain's menu despite its popularity. A spokesman says the chalupa was always planned as a limited-time offer product It's unclear how much the popular chalupa generated in sales for Taco Bell within the near month of its release. It's also unclear by how much it exceeded the company's sales expectations. Taco Bell tested the product at locations in California and Missouri for the past two years. After testing, the chalupa made its national debut on January 26. The chalupa alone costs $2.99, and is available in a $5 box that includes a Doritos Locos Taco, a Crunchy Taco and a medium drink.
